name: SSC FLIGHT SYSTEM
effect: The Ace can fly whenever they move or Boost.

name: BARREL ROLL
effect: The Ace performs a barrel roll, flying 6 spaces in any direction and causing the attack to miss. This movement ignores engagement and does not provoke reactions.
trigger: A melee or ranged attack hits the Ace.

name: BOMBING BAY
effect: If the Ace is flying when they move or Boost, they may drop a bomb on one character below or adjacent to the path taken. This causes a Blast 1 explosion that must overlap with at least 1 space occupied by their target. Characters within the affected area must succeed on an Agility save or take {6/8/10} Explosive damage and be knocked Prone.

name: STRAFE
effect: 1/round, as a quick action, the Ace can fly spaces equal to Speed in any direction, automatically dealing {3/4/6} Kinetic damage to one character below or adjacent to the path taken.

name: MISSILE SWARM
effect: This weapon deals double damage to characters with Lock On and doesn’t affect allied characters.

name: RAPID RESPONSE
effect: The Ace may Boost.
trigger: An enemy character in line of sight moves.

name: CHAFF LAUNCHERS
effect: After using Barrel Roll, the Ace counts as being in soft cover until the end of their next turn; additionally, Barrel Roll can be used against tech attacks.

name: DEFENSE NET
effect:
The Aegis spreads a powerful, shimmering repulsion shield over a Burst 3 area. While active, the Aegis is Immobilized, but all ranged, melee, and tech attacks against characters or objects within the affected area that originate outside the area receive +2 Difficulty and cannot result in critical hits. Characters within the affected area may attack characters within and outside of the area normally.
Allied characters within the affected area also gain Immunity to Impaired and Slowed, and remove these conditions when they enter the area if they already have them.
This effect lasts until the Aegis ends it as a protocol, or until the Aegis is Stunned, Jammed, or destroyed. Involuntary movement causes the shield to move with the Aegis.

name: REGENERATIVE SHIELDING
effect: The Aegis has Immunity to Impaired and Slowed and can’t be critically hit.

name: ADAPTIVE SHIELDING
effect: The first time each round an ally affected by Defense Net takes damage, all allies within the Net gain Resistance to the damage type taken. This lasts until the end of the Aegis’s next turn.

name: GUARDIAN
effect: Allied characters can use the Aegis for hard cover.

name: RING OF FIRE
effect: Any hostile characters that start their turn inside the area affected by the Defense Net or that enter it for the first time in a round take 2 heat and become Shredded until they leave the area.

name: HARDLIGHT COVER SYSTEM
effect: As a quick action, deploy a line3 hardlight wall. The wall is immune to damage and effects and grants hard cover. Characters that receive this cover gain Resistance to damage from Line, Blast, Burst, and Cone attacks.

name: HA BLACKWALL SYSTEM
effect: As a full action, the Aegis generates a pitch-black wall of blinkspace 5 spaces high covering a line10 area starting within range 5. All spaces must be free. The wall blocks line of sight, effects or attacks and provides hard cover. Characters that start their turn in the wall or who enter it on their turn roll 1d6. On a 4+ they are removed from play until the end of their next turn, when they reappear in a free space of their choice in Range 10 of the wall. If there are no free spaces, they return when a space becomes free. The wall lasts until the Aegis ends it as a quick action, or is destroyed. When it ends, characters remaining in blinkspace reappear.

name: SUPPRESS
effect:
The Archer chooses a target within line of sight and Range 10: they become Impaired and the Archer gains the Moving Target reaction.
This effect lasts until the Archer uses Moving Target; the target damages the Archer or leaves the Archer’s line of sight; the Archer is Stunned, Jammed, or destroyed; the Archer chooses a new target for this action; or, the Archer ends it as a free action.

name: MOVING TARGET
effect: Interrupt with a single weapon’s attack.
trigger: The Archer’s Suppress target starts to move.

name: SUPERIOR SENTINEL
effect: The Archer gains +1 Accuracy on all attacks made as reactions (e.g., Overwatch).

name: BLINDING SHELLS
effect: After the Archer makes a successful attack, they force their target to make an Engineering save. On a failure, the target only has line of sight to adjacent spaces until their next turn ends.

name: IMPENDING THREAT
effect: The character must choose: lose the triggering action/movement, or continue but let the Archer immediately attack them with a single weapon.
trigger: A hostile character in line of sight and Range 10 from the Archer moves or takes action.

name: COVERING FIRE
effect: The Archer chooses a Blast 3 area within line of sight and Range 10 and gains the Got Your Back reaction.

name: GOT YOUR BACK
effect: The Archer may attack that character.
trigger: A character in the area makes an attack.

name: RAPID RESPONSE
effect: The Archer may Boost.
trigger: An enemy character in line of sight moves.

name: HAIL OF FIRE
effect: The Archer chooses an enemy character within Range 10: they become Immobilized and Impaired until the end of their next turn, until the Archer is Stunned or Jammed, or until the target allows the Archer to attack them with a single weapon as a reaction.

name: KAI BIOPLATING
effect: The Assassin gains +1 Accuracy on all Agility checks; additionally, they climb and swim at normal speed, ignore difficult terrain, and, when making a standard move, can jump horizontally up to their Speed and vertically up to half their Speed (in any combination).

name: HEATED BLADE
effect: Deals double damage to Prone, Shredded, Immobilized, or Stunned targets.

name: ASSASSIN’S MARK
effect:
The Assassin chooses a character in line of sight. For the rest of the scene, these effects apply:
  • It has Resistance to that target’s damage.
  • Damage it deals to that target cannot be reduced.
  • It gains +1 Accuracy on all saves forced by that target.

The Assassin can only choose a new target if the current target is destroyed.

name: LEAP
effect: The Assassin flies 6 spaces in any direction but must land on a surface. When they land, characters adjacent to the Assassin must succeed on an Agility save or be knocked Prone.

name: SAP
effect: The Assassin chooses a character next to them: they must succeed on an Engineering save or be Stunned until the end of their next turn.

name: SPINNING KICK
effect: The Assassin chooses a character next to them: they must pass a Hull save or be pushed 4 spaces away from the Assassin and knocked Prone.

name: CLOUD PROJECTOR
effect: The Assassin sets off a charge, creating a Burst 3 area of smoke, haze, or some other kind of concealing shroud. The Assassin gains soft cover within the affected area, and characters other than the Assassin fully inside or outside the area cannot draw line of sight into or out of the area. Characters partially within the area are not affected. This effect lasts until the end of the Assassin’s next turn, or until the Assassin uses this system again.

name: EXPLOSIVE KNIVES
effect: The Assassin expends a charge to throw an Explosive damage knife at a character within range 3, making a ranged attack at +{2/4/6}. On a hit, the knife embeds itself in the target and explodes at the end of their next turn, dealing {6/8/10} Explosive damage in a Burst 1 area.

name: HUNKER DOWN
effect: Gain Resistance to all damage from the attack.
trigger: An attack hits the Assault, but damage hasn’t been rolled yet.

name: MICRO-MISSILE BARRAGE
effect: The Assault launches a Line 8 volley of micro-missiles. All characters within the affected area must succeed on a Hull save or take {6/8/10} kinetic damage. On a successful save, they take half damage.

name: HIGH IMPACT ROUNDS
effect: These high-caliber rounds can only be used with the Heavy Assault Rifle. When firing with these rounds, the Assault’s attacks become AP and deal +4 kinetic damage, but the Heavy Assault Rifle must be reloaded before it is used again (as though it was Loading).

name: AUTO-TARGETING
effect: The Assault ignores cover when attacking, although they still require line of sight.

name: RANK DISCIPLINE
effect: The Assault gains +1 Accuracy on all attacks, checks, and saves while adjacent to at least one allied character with the Mech tag.

name: GRAVITON LANCE
effect: At T2–3, this weapon can make two attacks at once, hitting one character twice or two characters once.
on_hit: Target is Slowed until the end of their next turn.

name: MOBILE PRINTER
effect: The Barricade prints a Size 2 cube in a free and adjacent area. The cube provides hard cover and is a single object with 20 HP and Evasion 5.

name: SHOCK PLATING
effect: The Barricade has Resistance to kinetic damage.

name: BULWARK MODS
effect: The Barricade ignores difficult terrain and dangerous terrain.

name: DRAG DOWN
effect: The Barricade makes a tech attack against a character within Sensors. On a success, they take 2 AP Energy damage per space that they voluntarily move until the end of their next turn.

name: SEISMIC REPULSOR
effect: All non-flying characters within a Burst 3 area must pass a Hull save or be knocked 3 spaces back from the Barricade and knocked Prone. The affected area becomes difficult terrain for the rest of the scene.

name: EXTRUDITE
effect: The Barricade can print two separate cubes at a time with Mobile Printer, instead of one.

name: HUNGER/PURSUIT LIMPETS
effect: The Barricade rapidly prints and deploys a field of tiny, mobile mines in a free Size 4 area adjacent to them. The affected area becomes difficult terrain; additionally, hostile characters that enter the area for the first time in a round or start their turn there must succeed on a Systems save or be Slowed until the end of their next turn.

name: TITAN-SNARE DRONE
effect:
Snare Drone (Size 1/2, HP {5/10/15}, Evasion {10/12/14}, E-Defense {10/12/14}, Tags: Drone)
This drone can be printed and deployed to any free adjacent space. When hostile characters move into or start their turn within range 3 of the drone, it emits a pulse, and they become Immobilized until the drone is destroyed.

name: FRIENDLY INTERDICTION
effect: The Bastion and one allied character adjacent to it gain Resistance to all damage dealt by one character within line of sight. The Bastion may choose a new allied character or target as a protocol. The allied character loses Resistance if they break adjacency.

name: GUARDIAN
effect: Allied characters can use the Bastion for hard cover.

name: NEAR-THREAT DENIAL SYSTEM
effect: When characters within range 3 attack the Bastion, they take {2/3/4} AP Explosive damage before rolling.

name: SIEGE GUARDIAN
effect: Allied characters gain Resistance to damage from Blast, Burst, Line, and Cone attacks while they’re adjacent to the Bastion.

name: “PAUSE” ENGINE
effect: The Bastion and one adjacent allied character are temporarily shielded by a flickering pane of portable blinkspace, gaining Immunity to all damage and effects until the start of the Bastion’s next turn. The allied character loses Immunity if it breaks adjacency. At the start of their Bastion’s next turn, they become Stunned until the start of their following turn.

name: FEARLESS DEFENDER
effect: The Bastion can move to an adjacent space and take the damage instead.
trigger: An allied character in range 5 of the Bastion takes damage, and the Bastion isn’t Immobilized, Slowed, Stunned or otherwise cannot move.

name: DEATHCOUNTER
effect: The first time the Bastion is successfully hit by a ranged or melee attack each round, all damage is reduced to 0.

name: CHAIN AXE
effect: On critical hit: Target becomes Shredded until the end of their next turn.

name: STAMPEDE DEFENSE
effect: The Berserker has Resistance to all damage unless they are Impaired, Stunned, Immobilized, Shredded, Slowed or Exposed.

name: AGGRESSION
effect: After taking damage for the first time each round, the Berserker must immediately attack a random adjacent character – hostile or allied – with the Chain Axe.

name: AVALANCHE CHARGE
effect: The Berserker moves spaces equal to their Speed in a straight line, ignoring reactions and engagement, then attacks a random adjacent character – hostile or allied—with the Chain Axe.

name: JUGGERNAUT
effect: When the Berserker uses Avalanche Charge, all characters adjacent to the path they follow or adjacent to their final position – hostile and allied – must succeed on a Hull save or be knocked Prone.

name: HARPOON CANNON
on_hit: Targets of smaller or equal Size to the Berserker are pulled adjacent to them in a straight line, or as close as possible. If they’re larger, the Berserker is pulled adjacent to them instead. If the target ends their movement adjacent, the Berserker Grapples them.

name: NAIL GUN
on_hit: Target rolls an Agility save. On a failure, they are Immobilized until the end of their next turn.

name: RETRIBUTION
effect: Whenever the Berserker takes damage, their next attack deals +{2/3/4} bonus damage. This bonus stacks up to +8. Bonuses are lost when the Berserker attacks, or at the end of their next turn.

name: SUPERHOT
effect: The Berserker gains Resistance to the attack’s damage and the attacker must succeed on an Engineering save or take {2/4/6} Burn.
trigger: The Berserker takes damage from a melee attack.

name: CLUSTER MUNITIONS
effect: The Bombard’s attacks deal +{2/3/4} damage to all targets for each target beyond the first.

name: EARTHSHAKER SHELLS
effect: When attacking with the Bombard Cannon, the Bombard may also fire a special earthshaker shell. In addition to any damage, characters within Burst 3 of the targeted space must succeed on a Hull save or be knocked Prone. Debris or broken earth is thrown up by the impact, creating two Size 1 segments of hard cover in free spaces of the Bombard’s choice (within the affected area).

name: SIEGE ARMOR
effect: The Bombard has Resistance to all damage from attacks that originate beyond range 3.

name: HIGH-IMPACT SHELLS
effect: On a hit, the Bombard Cannon knocks targets 3 spaces away from the Bombard.

name: BUNKER BUSTER
effect: The Bombard Cannon deals {10/15/20} AP Explosive damage to objects and terrain in the affected area, no roll required.

name: FLARE DRONE
effect:
Flare Drone (Size 1/2, HP {10/20/30}, Evasion 10, E-Defense 10, Tags: Drone)
This drone can be deployed to a space within line of sight and range 25, where it hovers in place and begins projecting bright light in a Burst 2 area. All characters in the affected area – including those that move into the affected area or start their turn within it – lose Invisible and Hidden, and cannot Hide or turn Invisible within the area. Additionally, the Bombard gains +1 Accuracy to attacks against characters within the affected area.
The drone can take damage from the Bombard’s attacks, and the Bombard can only have one drone deployed at a time; if a new drone is deployed, the old one disintegrates.

name: CLUSTER-SEEKER BOMBS
effect: When the Bombard attacks with the Bombard Cannon, three characters of their choice within range 3 of the targeted space take {2/3/4} Explosive damage, hit or miss.

name: DUAL SHOTGUNS
effect: This weapon can make two attacks at once, targeting either the same character or different ones.

name: BREACH RAM
effect: The Breacher moves up to 6 spaces in a straight line, ignoring engagement and passing through – but not stopping in – spaces occupied by other characters. Obstructions and objects in the Breacher’s path take {10/20/30} AP kinetic damage. The Breacher passes through any obstructions destroyed this way and continues moving until they have moved 6 spaces or fail to destroy an obstruction. Any characters in the Breacher’s path must succeed on an Agility save or be pushed out of the way as directly as possible and knocked Prone.

name: BREAK ARMOR
effect: Characters that are successfully attacked more than once in a turn by the Breacher’s Dual Shotguns become Shredded for the rest of the scene.

name: PAINMAKER
effect: The Breacher chooses a character within range 3. Their next turn is delayed until after their target’s. At the start of the Breacher’s turn, if the target is still within range 3, the Breacher may attack them four times with Dual Shotguns – instead of twice – as a free action.

name: SUPERIOR RAM
effect: When using Breach Ram the Breacher moves 4 more spaces, and targets have +1 Difficulty on the Agility save.

name: FOLLOWER COUNT
effect: The Breacher makes a tech attack against a character within Sensors. On a success, the Breacher gains +{1/2/3} Accuracy on all attacks against their target, and may Boost once per turn as a free action so long as it moves them directly towards their target. This lasts until either character is destroyed and cannot be changed to a new target.

name: THERMAL CHARGE
effect: The Breacher may expend a charge to throw a grenade to a space within range 5. Characters in the ensuing Blast 2 explosion take {2/4/6} Burn if they fail an Agility save, half on a success. Objects, terrain, and Deployables take {10/20/30} AP kinetic damage.

name: FLECHETTE SHOT
effect: Attacks with this weapon take the form of a Cone 3 shrapnel attack starting from the edge of the targeted space, attacking all characters within both the targeted space and the affected area. The Cone cannot change directions.

name: RAM CANNON
effect: This lance can be used as either a ranged or melee weapon, but not both in the same turn. At T2–3, this weapon can make two attacks at a time, targeting either the same character or two different ones.

name: TRAMPLE
effect: The Cataphract ignores engagement and can pass through – but not stop in – spaces occupied by other characters, 1/turn dealing {2/3/4} kinetic damage to those characters.

name: IMPALE
effect: The Cataphract moves up to 8 spaces in a straight line. Pick a character that the Cataphract passed through or ended adjacent to; they make a Hull save at +1 Difficulty. On a failure, they are grappled by the Cataphract and pulled with the Cataphract to the end of their movement.

name: POINT-DEFENSE SHIELD
effect: The Cataphract has Resistance to all damage from the closest hostile character. If multiple characters are equally close, this effect does not apply.

name: ELECTRIFIED LASSO
effect: A character in line of sight and range 5 must make a Hull save. On a failure, they are pulled as close as possible to the Cataphract; if they become adjacent, the Cataphract automatically grapples them.

name: LANCE SHOT
effect: The Cataphract fires an electrified lance in a line5 path. All characters within the affected area must succeed on an Engineering save or become Jammed until the end of their next turn.

name: ELECTRIFIED BOLA
effect: A flying character in Range 10 must make an Agility save. On a failure, they land immediately and become Immobilized until the end of their next turn. This counts as falling but without damage.

name: CAPACITOR DISCHARGE
effect: As long as the Cataphract isn’t Slowed or Immobilized, they gain Resistance to Energy damage and heat. At the end of the Cataphract’s turn, all characters adjacent to them take {2/3/4} Heat.

name: CHARGE
effect: The Cataphract moves spaces equal to Speed in a straight line, ignoring reactions and engagement, then attacks a target within Range with the Ram Cannon.

name: DEMOLITION HAMMER
on_hit: Targets must succeed on a Hull save or be Stunned until the end of their next turn.

name: DIG IN
effect: It gains Resistance to all damage from the attack, but become Slowed until the end of its next turn.
trigger: An attack hits the Demolisher, but damage hasn’t been rolled yet.

name: SHOCK ARMOR
effect: The Demolisher has Resistance to damage from melee weapons.

name: HEAVY FRAME
effect: The Demolisher can’t be pushed, pulled, knocked Prone, or knocked back by smaller characters.

name: BROAD-SWEEP HAFT
effect: The Demolisher swings the Demolition Hammer in a Burst 2 arc instead of attacking normally. Roll melee attacks against any characters of their choice within the affected area. On hit, targets take {4/6/8} Explosive damage and become Impaired until the end of their next turn.

name: KINETIC COMPENSATION
effect: Each time the Demolisher misses with the Demolition Hammer, they gain +1 Accuracy on all subsequent attacks until their next hit. This Accuracy can be gained multiple times, and stacks.

name: CONCUSSION MISSILES
effect: All characters of the Demolisher’s choice in line of sight and range 5 must succeed on a Hull save or become Slowed and Impaired until the end of their next turn.

name: SEISMIC DESTROYER
effect: Unless they can fly, all characters in a Cone 3 or line5 area must succeed on an Agility save or be Stunned until the end of their next turn.

name: SAP
effect: The Demolisher chooses a character next to them: they must succeed on an Engineering save or be Stunned until the end of their next turn.

name: FLAK CANNON
effect: This weapon has +2 Accuracy against flying targets.

name: DEPLOYABLE TURRET
effect:
Deployable Turret (Size 1/2, HP {5/8/10}, Evasion 10, E-Defense 10, Tags: Drone)
One of these self-constructing turrets can be deployed to any free, adjacent space. On the Engineer’s turn, deployed turrets attack the nearest hostile character within Range 10. They attack at +{1/2/3} and deal {4/5/6} Kinetic damage. The Engineer may have six turrets deployed at one time, all of which are disabled if the Engineer is destroyed.

name: ENGINEER’S MARK
effect: Until the end of the Engineer’s next turn, the Engineer’s Deployable Turrets will attack a target of their choice (within Range) instead of attacking the nearest hostile character.

name: POWER DEPLOYER
effect: The Engineer can deploy two turrets at a time with Deployable Turrets. If they do so, the system counts as Recharge 4+ until it next recharges.

name: SKYSHIELD PROTOCOL
effect: Deployable Turrets gain +2 Accuracy against flying targets.

name: SHEPHERD FIELD
effect: Drones, objects, and pieces of cover gain Resistance to all damage while next to the Engineer.

name: MOBILE TURRETS
effect: At the start of the Engineer’s turn, they can move all deployable turrets up to 3 spaces in any direction.

name: ARSENAL
effect:
When the Engineer uses Deployable Turret, they can choose one of these modifications for their turrets:
  • Inferno: The turret’s attacks become Cone 3, {2/3/4} Burn.
  • Hellstorm: The turret’s attacks become range 15, Blast 1, {2/3/4} Explosive damage.
  • Hunter: The turret’s attacks gain Reliable 1.
  • Primed: When either the turret or Engineer is destroyed, the turret explodes in a Burst 1 area. Characters within the affected area must succeed on an Agility save or take {7/9/11} Explosive damage.

name: DRUM SHOTGUN
effect: At T2, this weapon can make two attacks at a time, targeting either the same character or two different ones. At T3, it can make three attacks at a time.

name: CRUSH TARGETING
effect: A character within line of sight and Sensors gains +3 difficulty to attack against any character other than the Goliath until the start of the Goliath’s next turn.

name: HEAVY FRAME
effect: The Goliath can’t be pushed, pulled, knocked Prone, or knocked back by smaller characters.

name: GUARDIAN
effect: Allied characters can use the Goliath for hard cover.

name: SIEGE ARMOR
effect: The Goliath has Resistance to all damage from attacks that originate beyond range 3.

name: POWER KNUCKLE
effect: A character within range 2 must pass a Hull save or take {4/5/6} Kinetic damage, be pushed 5 spaces directly away from the Goliath, and knocked Prone.

name: PIN
effect: A character within range 2 becomes Immobilized and Impaired until they either damage the Goliath, the Goliath is Stunned or destroyed, or the Goliath targets another character with this effect. The Goliath is Immobilized for the duration of this effect.

name: CRUSHING EMBRACE
effect: A character adjacent to the Goliath must succeed on an Agility save or automatically be grappled by the Goliath and become Jammed until they are no longer grappled. The Goliath can only grapple one character this way at a time.

name: WATCHFUL GUARDIAN
effect: Allied characters that benefit from the cover provided by the Goliath gain Resistance to all damage.

name: RETRIBUTION
effect: Whenever the Goliath takes damage, their next attack deals +{2/3/4} bonus damage. This bonus stacks up to +8. Bonuses are lost when the Goliath attacks, or at the end of their next turn.

name: HUNTER-KILLER NEXUS
effect: At T2, this weapon can make two attacks at a time, targeting either the same character or two different ones. At T3, it can make three attacks at a time.

name: DRONE BARRAGE
effect: The Hive makes a tech attack against a character within Sensors. On a success, the target chooses one: they become Immobilized and Impaired until the end of their next turn, or they immediately move up to 5 spaces in a direction chosen by the Hive. This movement ignores engagement and does not provoke reactions.

name: RAZOR SWARMS
effect: The Hive deploys a Blast 1 razor swarm in a free area within Sensors. Allied characters gain soft cover as long as they are at least partially within the affected area. Hostile characters start their turn at least partially within the area or move into it for the first time in a round take {2/4/6} Burn. The Hive can deploy any number of razor swarms, each of which persists for the rest of the scene or until the Hive is destroyed.

name: ELECTRO-NANITE CLOUD
effect: At the start of their turn, hostile characters within range 3 take 2 Burn; additionally, until they move beyond range 3, they make all System checks and saves, and all tech attacks, at +{1/2/3} difficulty.

name: MOTILE SWARM
effect: At the start of the Hive’s turn, they may move all razor swarms up to 2 spaces in any direction, including into spaces occupied by other characters.

name: DRIVING SWARM
effect: Whenever characters take Burn from a razor swarm, they must succeed on a Systems save or immediately move 4 spaces in a direction chosen by the Hive after taking damage. This movement ignores engagement and does not provoke reactions.

name: GRIND MANIPLE
effect: The Hive releases a swarm of tiny, hard to hit drones that make a tech attack against a hostile character within Sensors and line of sight. On hit, the drones clamp on, causing them to take 2 Burn each time they take any action or reaction until the end of their next turn.

name: SEEKER CLOUD
effect: Characters damaged by this weapon gain Lock On.

name: STINGER PISTOL
on_hit: Targets become Impaired until the end of their next turn.

name: SSC TOTAL SUITE
effect: The Hornet can hover whenever they move or Boost.

name: WEAVE
effect: Each round, the first attack made against the Hornet as a reaction automatically fails.

name: IMPALE SYSTEMS
effect: The Hornet makes a tech attack against a character within Sensors. On a hit, they take {3/4/5} Heat and become Jammed until the end of their next turn.

name: ADAPT/EVADE/DISENGAGE
effect: The Hornet gains Immunity to Grapple and always ignores engagement.

name: UMBRAL INTERDICTION
effect: The target must pass a Systems check or their attack automatically misses.
trigger: A character within Sensors and line of sight attempts an attack.

name: SUPERSONIC
effect: The Hornet flies to a space in line of sight and range 50 so impossibly fast that it counts as teleportation.

name: LOCK/HOLD JAVELINS
effect: The Hornet fires a javelin at a character within range 5 and line of sight. The target must succeed on a Hull save or be impaled, at which point the javelin tethers itself and its victim to the ground (or another surface), rendering them Immobilized and Shredded. They, or any adjacent character, can attempt to remove the javelin with a successful Hull save as a full action; otherwise, this effect lasts for the rest of the scene or until the Hornet takes this action again.

name: WARP SENSORS
effect: The Mirage makes a tech attack against a target within Sensors. On a success, they take {2/3/4} Heat and all attacks they make until the end of their next turn treat their targets as having soft cover.

name: REALITY FLICKER
effect: The Mirage teleports when they make a standard move.

name: DATAVEIL
effect: By default, the Mirage is Invisible and can transfer this status to another character within line of sight as a quick action. When they do so, the Mirage ceases to be Invisible, and only regains the status when they transfer it back as a quick action or transfer it to another character; otherwise, this effect lasts until the Mirage is destroyed.

name: GLITCH SCANNERS
effect:
The Mirage’s advanced electronic countermeasures play havoc with enemy systems, causing them to register false positives on the battlefield. They may teleport up to two allied characters within Sensors, moving them 5 spaces in any direction – revealing their “true” locations. This movement ignores engagement and doesn’t provoke reactions.
The Mirage also gains the Blip reaction.

name: BLIP
effect: The Mirage may teleport one allied character within Sensors 5 spaces in any direction.
trigger: A hostile character takes action in line of sight.

name: ILLUSORY SUBROUTINES
effect: The Mirage makes a tech attack against a target within Sensors. On a success, the target treats all characters allied to the Mirage as Invisible until the start of their next turn.

name: WARP TARGETING
effect: All allied characters within range 50 benefit from soft cover. If the Mirage takes damage, this effect ends until the start of their next turn.

name: METAFOLD SHOVE
effect: The Mirage makes a tech attack against a hostile character within range 5. On a success, the target swaps position with an allied character within the Mirage’s line of sight and chosen by the Mirage, both teleporting. Flying characters can’t be swapped with characters that aren’t flying, and vice versa.

name: MANIFEST FALSE IDOLS
effect: The Mirage creates three Size 1 data constructs in free spaces within line of sight and range 5. These constructs provide soft cover but can be passed through. When hostile characters pass through a construct, the construct disappears and they must succeed on a Systems save or take 2 heat and become Jammed until the end of their next turn. At any point during the Mirage’s turn, they can teleport an allied character within line of sight to the location of a data construct as a quick action, causing the construct to disappear, as long as there is space to do so.

name: MULTIPLICITY
effect: The attacker must make a Systems save. On a failure, the Mirage’s ally gains Immunity to the attack’s damage and effects and may teleport up to 5 spaces in the direction of their choice.
trigger: A allied character in line of sight is hit.

name: RAPTOR PLASMA RIFLE
effect: At T2, this weapon can make two attacks at a time, targeting either the same character or two different ones. At T3, it can make three attacks at a time.

name: TRACE DRIVE
effect: The Operator teleports when they make their standard move.

name: STEP
effect: The Operator teleports to a free space within line of sight and range 50.

name: SELF-ERASURE
effect: When the Operator’s mech is destroyed, it immediately self-immolates in a wave of superheated plasma. All characters adjacent to the Operator when this takes place must succeed on an Agility save or take {4/6/8} Energy damage. On a success, they take half damage. This mech is then removed from the battlefield – it is utterly annihilated.

name: FADE GENERATOR
effect: At the end of the Operator’s turn, they become Invisible until the start of their next turn. This immediately ceases if they take damage or make a reaction.

name: TELEFRAG
effect: The Operator teleports into a space occupied by another character within line of sight and range 15. The target must succeed on an Agility save or take {4/8/12} AP Energy damage and become Jammed until the end of their next turn. On a successful save, they take half damage and aren’t Jammed. Succeed or fail, the Operator takes 1d6 AP Energy damage and is placed into a free space next to the target.

name: FORTRESS
effect: The Operator gains +3 Accuracy on Systems saves, and tech attacks against them receive +3 difficulty.

name: SKIRMISHER
effect: Once per turn, at any point during the Operator’s turn, they may Boost as a free action.

name: ABJURE
effect: The Priest makes a tech attack against a target within Sensors. On a success, the target takes {2/3/4} Heat each time they make any attack until the end of their next turn.

name: HARDENED TARGET
effect: The Priest gains +1 Accuracy on Systems saves, and tech attacks against them receive +1 Difficulty.

name: INVESTITURE
effect: The Priest links systems with an allied mech or vehicle within range 5. As long as they remain linked and within range 5, the target gets +{1/2/3} Accuracy on all attacks and can use the Priest’s Systems instead of their own. If either character becomes Jammed, Impaired, or Stunned, however, the other character also receives the condition for the same duration or until the link is disabled. The link is disabled if either character is destroyed or moves more than 5 spaces from the other. The Priest can only link with one character at a time.

name: DISPERSAL SHIELD
effect: The Priest releases a cloud of miniature drones that cluster around a nearby mech, providing protection. The Priest or an allied character within Sensors gains Resistance to damage and heat from the next 1d3 attacks that hit. This effect is not cumulative.

name: GREATER INVESTITURE
effect: Investiture gives its target Resistance to all damage, but the Priest becomes Immobilized while linked.

name: EMPOWERED SHIELD
effect: Dispersal Shield also grants Overshield {5/6/8}.

name: SANCTUARY
effect: The Priest chooses an allied character within Sensors. Before attacking the target, characters must first pass a Systems save. On a failure, the target cannot be targeted again by the attacker until the start of that character’s next turn.

name: FORTRESS
effect: Hardened Target gives +3 Accuracy on Systems saves and deals +3 difficulty on tech attacks, instead of +1.

name: FRACTAL ASSAULT
effect: The attacker makes a System save. If it fails, they’re Stunned until the end of their next turn.
trigger: A character linked by Investiture takes damage.

name: FLAMETHROWER
effect: This weapon deals double Burn to characters that already have any Burn.

name: EXPLOSIVE VENT
effect: The Pyro clears all heat. Characters in Burst 1 must pass an Agility save or take heat equal to half the amount the Pyro cleared and be knocked Prone.

name: INSULATED
effect: The Pyro has Immunity to Burn.

name: FIREBREAK SHIELD
effect: At the end of the Pyro’s turn, they create a Line 4 Energy damage shield, 4 spaces high, in free spaces within line of sight and with at least 1 space adjacent to the Pyro. It doesn’t block line of sight but provides soft cover; when an attack is made against a character benefiting from the cover, it misses on a 4+ on 1d6. This lasts until the start of the Pyro’s next turn, or if the Pyro moves or is Stunned. It doesn’t stack with Invisible.

name: UNSHIELDED REACTOR
effect: Characters that start their turn adjacent to the Pyro or become adjacent to the Pyro for the first time on their turn take {2/3/4} Heat.

name: SIEGE ARMOR
effect: The Pyro has Resistance to all damage from attacks that originate beyond range 3.

name: SUPERHOT
effect: The Pyro gains Resistance to all damage from the attack. The attacker must pass an Engineering save or take {2/4/6} Burn.
trigger: The Pyro takes damage from a melee attack.

name: EXPLOSIVE JET
effect: Enemies within Burst 2 must succeed on a Hull save or be knocked outside of the area and knocked Prone. The Pyro then flies 5 spaces in any direction, but must land after completing that move.

name: MISSILE PODS
effect: This weapon can attack 1-3 characters at a time.

name: JAVELIN ROCKETS
effect:
The Rainmaker chooses 3 free spaces within line of sight and range 20 that are not adjacent to each other. All characters know which spaces have been chosen. The Rainmaker fires a volley of auto-targeting rockets into the air: the next time a hostile character moves through, starts their turn in, or passes above one of the chosen spaces – no more than 10 spaces up – they are hit by a rocket, taking {5/6/7} kinetic damage. Each space can only be triggered once.
This effect lasts until the start of the Rainmaker’s next turn.

name: HUNTSMAN
effect: Against characters with Lock On, the Rainmaker’s weapons gain Smart, Seeking, and AP.

name: HADES MISSILES
effect: All characters in a Cone 3 area starting within range 20 of the Rainmaker take {4/6/8} Energy damage and 2 heat, half if they pass an Agility save. This system doesn’t need line of sight, just a possible route to the target.

name: HOUND MISSILES
effect:
Hound Missile (Size 1/2, HP {10/15/20}, Evasion 10, E-Defense 10, Tags: Drone).
The Rainmaker deploys the Hound Missile in an adjacent space and picks a target in range 20 and line of sight. At the start of the Rainmaker’s turns the missile flies 3 spaces towards its target, 6 if the target has Lock On. It moves directly, maneuvering round cover and terrain if needed. When it collides with a character or reaches its target, it creates a Burst 1 explosion. Characters in the affected area take {16/20/24} Energy damage, half if they pass an Agility save.

name: ENDLESS RAIN
effect: The Rainmaker picks 6 spaces for Javelin Rockets, not 3.

name: VOLLEY
effect: Pick characters in range 20 and line of sight. They take {4/6/8} Explosive damage, half if they pass an Agility save.

name: ATLAS MISSILES
effect: The Rainmaker chooses a space of ground in line of sight and Range 30, obvious to all characters with line of sight to the space. The Rainmaker launches a missile that lands at the end of the next round making a Blast 2 explosion; affected characters take {16/20/24} Explosive damage, half if they pass an Agility save.

name: CARBON FIBER SWORD
effect:
On Critical Hits: Deal +1d6 Kinetic damage.
At T2, this weapon can make two attacks at a time, targeting either the same character or two different ones. At T3, it can make three attacks at a time.

name: REBOUND
effect: They roll 1d6: on 4+, they gain Resistance to damage from that attack, and the attacker must repeat the attack against themselves.
trigger: The Ronin takes damage from a ranged attack.

name: CHARGED SLASH
effect: All characters adjacent to the Ronin take {6/9/12} kinetic damage, half if they pass an Agility save.

name: CHAFF LAUNCHERS
effect: The Ronin gains soft cover until the start of their next turn whenever they Boost.

name: ECHO EDGE
effect: Characters damaged by the Ronin gain a Ronin’s Mark. At the start of the Ronin’s turn, the Ronin can clear all Ronin’s Marks as a free action, automatically dealing 1d6 AP Kinetic damage to all characters that have a Ronin’s Mark cleared in this way.

name: INSTINCT MODE
effect: Until the end of the Ronin’s next turn, the first time each turn that they are targeted by an attack, the Ronin may first use the Carbon Fiber Sword to attack a character within Range as a reaction.

name: EXTENDED BLADE
effect: The Ronin’s Carbon Fiber Sword becomes Threat 3. The first time each turn that the Ronin performs a critical hit with it, all characters within Threat take {2/3/4} kinetic damage – including the target.

name: FOCUS DOWN
effect: When the Scourer hits with the Thermal Lance, targets take {5/7/8} Burn if they were also successfully hit with the Thermal Lance in the previous round.

name: COOLING MODULE
effect: At the start of their turn, the Scourer clears all heat if they haven’t moved – including involuntary movement – since the end of their previous turn.

name: ABLATIVE SHIELDING
effect: The Scourer has Resistance to Energy damage.

name: SUPERCHARGED
effect: Characters affected by Focus Down are also Shredded and Slowed until the end of their next turn.

name: EMERGENCY VENT
effect: When the Scourer exceeds their Heat Cap or becomes Stunned, they become Invisible until the start of their next turn.

name: PULSE LASER
effect: At T2–3 this weapon can make two attacks at a time, targeting the same character or two different ones.

name: FLASH LENS
effect: All characters in a Cone 5 area drawn from the Scourer must pass a Systems save or become Jammed until the start of the Scourer’s next turn.

name: MELT
effect: The Scourer makes a ranged attack against an object, deployable or Drone within Range 10, dealing 20 AP Energy damage on a success.

name: MARKER RIFLE
on_hit: Target receives Lock On. For as long as they have Lock On, they are also Shredded, and can’t Hide or become Invisible.

name: SIGHT
effect: The Scout ignores Hidden and Invisible – they know the precise location of all characters within Sensors.

name: REBOUND SCAN
effect: All characters of the Scout’s choice within range 5 must make a Systems save. On a failure, they immediately lose Hidden and Invisible, and can’t regain either status or benefit from any cover until the start of the Scout’s next turn.

name: CLOAKING FIELD
effect: The Scout generates a Burst 3 cloaking field that lasts until the end of their next turn. The Scout and allied characters within the affected area are Invisible, but the Scout is Immobilized while it is active.

name: SYSTEM FLAYER
effect: Characters that fail to save against Rebound Scan also receive Lock On and take {2/3/4} Heat.

name: SPOTTER
effect: While adjacent to the Scout, allied characters gain +1 Accuracy on all attack rolls.

name: EXPOSE WEAKNESS
effect: Characters that are successfully attacked with the Marker Rifle take +{4/6/8} bonus damage the next time they are successfully hit with a ranged or melee attack. If it isn’t triggered, this effect lasts for the rest of the scene.

name: DATAVEIL
effect: By default, the Scout is Invisible and can transfer this status to another character within line of sight as a quick action. When they do so, the Scout ceases to be Invisible, and only regains the status when they transfer it back as a quick action or transfer it to another character; otherwise, this effect lasts until the Scout is destroyed.

name: ORBITAL STRIKE
effect: The Scout chooses a space on the ground, within line of sight and range 20; all characters know that it has been chosen. The Scout calls in an orbital bombardment that hits at the end of the next round, creating a Burst 2 explosion. Characters in the affected area must make Agility saves. On a fail, they take {12/16/20} Energy damage and are knocked Prone. On a pass, they take half damage and remain standing.

name: LAY MINES
effect:
The Seeder deploys one of the mines below in a free space within range 3. Once deployed, the Seeder’s mines detonate when a hostile character moves over them, creating a Blast 1 explosion that affects both allied and hostile characters.
  • Stun Mine: Characters in the area that fail an Engineering save become Stunned until the end of their next turn.
  • Explosive Mine: Characters in the area take {8/12/16} Explosive damage, or half if they pass an Agility save.
  • Sealant Mine: Characters in the area that fail a Hull save become Immobilized until the end of their next turn, then Slowed until the end of their subsequent turn.
  • Shock Mine: Characters in the area that fail a Systems save become Jammed until the end of their next turn, then Impaired until the end of their subsequent turn.

The Seeder’s mines are Invisible and cannot be targeted, but hostile characters within Sensors can reveal them by succeeding on a Systems check. Characters can disarm them by succeeding on a Systems check as a quick action while in the same space; however, on a failure, the mine detonates.

name: HOPPING MINES
effect: Mines deployed with Lay Mines also activate when hostile characters fly or move up to 10 spaces above them, jumping up to 10 spaces high to detonate next to the first character they run into.

name: TRIPWIRES
effect: Lay Mines gains Recharge 5+. Mines deployed with Lay Mines now occupy a line3 area and detonate from the closest space when hostile characters move into or across the affected area.

name: SPEED DEPLOYER
effect: Lay Mines deploys two mines at a time, not one.

name: GRAV SPIKE
effect: A character within line of sight and range 5 must succeed on a Systems save, or a grav spike attaches itself to them. The Seeder can detonate all grav spikes as a protocol, causing targets to automatically take {4/6/8} AP Explosive damage and be pulled 3 spaces in a direction chosen by the Seeder. A quick action and passed Systems save removes a grav spike.

name: DET SPIKE
effect: Up to three characters in line of sight and range 5 must succeed on an Systems save, or a det spike attaches itself to them. At the start of the Seeder’s next turn, all det spikes detonate, creating Burst 1 explosions that deals {3/5/7} Explosive damage to all affected characters. Characters can take damage from more than one spike if the affected areas overlap.

name: EYE OF MIDNIGHT
effect: The Sentinel becomes Slowed but can take Overwatch 1/turn, instead of 1/round. Once activated, this effect lasts until it is deactivated as a quick action.

name: GUARDIAN
effect: Allied characters can use the Sentinel for hard cover.

name: PUNISHER AMMUNITION
effect: Characters damaged by the Sentinel’s Overwatch attacks also become Slowed until the end of their next turn.

name: WRATH-LOCK
effect: The Sentinel arms this system. Once armed, the Sentinel attacks twice the next time they attack with their Combat Shotgun, instead of one.

name: IMPALER
effect: When the Sentinel hits with Overwatch, their target must pass a Hull save or become Immobilized and Jammed until the end of their next turn.

name: RAPID RESPONSE
effect: After the movement the Sentinel may Boost.
trigger: An enemy character in line of sight moves.

name: BODYGUARD
effect: The Sentinel chooses an allied character within range 5 as their ward and gains the Reflexive Blow reaction.

name: REFLEXIVE BLOW
effect: The Sentinel first attacks the inciting character with Overwatch.
trigger: Someone attacks the Sentinel’s ward.

name: SNIPER’S MARK
effect:
A character within line of sight and range 25 gains the Sniper’s Mark. Against targets with the Sniper’s Mark, the Anti-Materiel Rifle deals 1 structure damage instead of its usual damage.
Characters know when they have the Sniper’s Mark. They ignore it and take damage normally if they are in cover or Prone. On their turn, characters with the Sniper’s Mark may drop Prone as a free action.
The Sniper can only mark one character at a time but can transfer the Sniper’s Mark to another character as a full action.

name: CLIMBER
effect: The Sniper can climb and remain stationary on any surface without penalty, including overhanging and vertical surfaces.

name: SELECTIVE LOADER
effect:
The Sniper can choose a special ammunition type before attacking with the Anti-Materiel Rifle. Attacks made with this ammunition function as usual, with an additional effect on a successful attack.
The Sniper may choose from the following:
  • Electromagnetic: Targets must must pass an Systems save or become Jammed until the end of their next turn.
  • Flare: Targets lose Hide or Invisible and cannot gain those statuses until the end of their next turn.
  • Impact: Targets must pass an Hull save or be knocked Prone.
  • Molten: Targets must pass an Engineering save or become Shredded until the end of their next turn.

name: DEFENSIVE GRAPPLE
effect: The Sniper pulls themselves to any point within range 5 with a grappling hook as though they are flying. The Sniper also has the Relocation reaction.

name: RELOCATION
effect: The Sniper uses Defensive Grapple.
trigger: An enemy character in line of sight moves.

name: SHROUD CHARGE
effect:
The Sniper sets off a charge, creating a Burst 3 area of smoke, haze, or some other kind of concealing shroud. The Sniper gains soft cover within the affected area, and characters other than the Sniper cannot draw line of sight into or out of the area. Characters partially within the area have line of sight to characters within and outside the area.
This effect lasts until the end of the Sniper’s next turn, or until the Sniper uses this system again.

name: MOVING TARGET
effect: The Sniper interrupts the movement. The character must either give up the triggering action/ movement, or be immediately attacked by the Sniper using the Anti-materiel Rifle. If the rifle isn’t loaded, the Sniper instead reloads it.
trigger: A character in line of sight and range 20 moves.

name: DEADMETAL ROUNDS
effect: The Sniper loads the Anti-Materiel Rifle with a special, over-penetrating round: the next attack they make with it becomes line 20.

name: MONOWIRE SWORD
effect: At T2, this weapon can make two attacks at a time, targeting either the same character or two different ones. At T3, it can make three attacks at a time.

name: PROWL
effect: The Specter moves spaces equal to Speed, then becomes Hidden. This movement ignores engagement and doesn’t provoke reactions.

name: TACTICAL CLOAK
effect: The Specter is permanently Invisible.

name: HUNT
effect: The Specter’s melee attacks deal +5 damage when no other characters are adjacent to their target.

name: FORTRESS
effect: The Specter gains +3 Accuracy on Systems saves, and tech attacks against them receive +3 difficulty.

name: DRAIN SYSTEMS
effect: The Specter makes a tech attack against an adjacent character. On a success, the target becomes Stunned. This effect lasts until a character other than the Specter starts their turn adjacent to the target or moves adjacent to the target.

name: STEP
effect: The Specter teleports to a free space within line of sight and range 50.

name: MACHINE PISTOL
effect: At T2, this weapon can make two attacks at a time, targeting either the same character or two different ones. At T3, it can make three attacks at a time.

name: WEAKNESS ANALYZER
effect: When the Specter starts the turn Hidden, their next attack (while Hidden) gains +{1/2/3} Accuracy and deals +1d6 Kinetic damage on a critical hit.

name: SEALANT GUN
effect:
The Support chooses a character within line of sight and Range 5, allied or hostile:
  • Allied: The target clears all Burn, but becomes Slowed until the end of their next turn.
  • Hostile: The target must succeed on an Agility save or become Slowed until the end of their next turn. Succeed or fail, a Burst 1 area around them becomes difficult terrain for the rest of the scene.

name: RESTOCK DRONE
effect:
Restock Drone (Size 1/2, HP {5/8/10}, Evasion {10/12/14}, E-Defense {10/12/14}, Tags: Drone)
This drone can be deployed hovering in a space within range 5. The next time an allied character moves through or next to the drone, it clamps on and discharges its reserves, letting them regain {5/10/15} HP.

name: NANO-REPAIR CLOUD
effect: While they are adjacent to the Support, allied characters roll twice on all saves and mech skill checks and choose the higher result.

name: REMOTE REBOOT
effect: The Support clears any two of the following conditions currently affecting an allied character in range 5: Impaired, Jammed, Stunned, and Slowed.

name: EMPOWERED CLOUD
effect: When they start their turn adjacent to the Support, allied characters may clear one condition.

name: REMOTE CLOUD
effect: The Support releases a Blast 2 nanite cloud within range 5. Allied characters that start their turn in the area or move into it for the first time on their turn regain {2/4/6} HP. The cloud disperses at the start of the Support’s next turn.

name: DEFENSIVE PULSE
effect:
All allied characters within range 3 clear Jammed and
Lock On.

name: LATCH DRONE
effect:
Latch Drone (Size 1/2, HP {5/10/15}, Evasion 10, E-Defense 10, Tags: Drone)
This self-deploying drone clamps onto a character within Range 3, occupying the same space and moving with them. While the drone is attached, the target regains {5/8/10} HP at the start of each of their turns and gains +1 Accuracy on all checks, saves, and attacks. Enemies can target the drone with attacks.

name: TEAR DOWN
effect: The Witch makes a tech attack against a character within Sensors. On a success, the target takes {1/2/3} heat immediately and then a further 4 Heat at the start of the Witch’s next turn.

name: BLIND
effect: The Witch makes a tech attack against a character within Sensors. On a success, the target only has line of sight to adjacent spaces until the end of their next turn.

name: PREDATORY LOGIC
effect: The Witch makes a tech attack against a character within Sensors. On a success, the target immediately and as a reaction uses a weapon chosen by the Witch to attack a character within Range chosen by the Witch.

name: BLUR
effect: During the Witch’s turn, they are Invisible.

name: SPREAD SUFFERING
effect: 1/round, when the Witch uses Quick Tech or Full Tech, they can repeat the option they chose as a free action targeting any character adjacent to the primary target.

name: DARK CLOUD
effect: The additional heat dealt by Tear Down on the Witch’s next turn increases to 7 heat if the target is in the Danger Zone.

name: CHAIN
effect: The Witch makes a tech attack against a character within Sensors. On a hit, the Witch chains their target’s systems to a space within range 3 of the target. If the target moves more than 3 spaces from that point (voluntarily or otherwise), they take {2/3/4} Heat and become Jammed until the end of their next turn, but the effect ends. Otherwise, they are chained until the Witch is destroyed or Stunned, or for the rest of the scene.

name: PETRIFY
effect: The Witch makes a tech attack against a character within Sensors. On a success, the target becomes Slowed. On their next turn, they also become Immobilized. On their following turn, they also become Stunned. All conditions end at the end of that turn.

name: PAIN TRANSFERENCE
effect: The Witch makes a tech attack against a character within Sensors. On a success, any time the target gains heat until the end of the Witch’s next turn, all of their allied characters within range 5 also gain the same amount of heat.

name: ARMORED
effect: +1–2 Armor

name: SOLDIERS
effect: The Squad acts as one character, but it represents a group of soldiers acting together. When the Squad takes a certain amount of damage, it results in the narrative death of one or more of those soldiers. Eventually, this reduces the number of attacks the Squad can make each turn, as listed in the relevant weapon profiles. By default, the Squad is made up of 10 members, each with 1 HP.

name: RANK AND FILE
effect: The Squad can’t take the Grunt, Veteran, or Ultra templates, and can never gain Structure.

name: STRENGTH IN NUMBERS
effect: The Squad has Resistance to all damage from attacks that aren’t line, Cone, Burst or Blast , and is Immune to Grapple, Ram, Knockback, and Stunned.

name: SPREAD OUT
effect: Instead of tracking the position of individual soldiers, the Squad’s members are assumed to move freely within the space it occupies. Other characters can freely move through and end their turn in spaces occupied by the Squad, and as long as the Squad occupies at least 2 free spaces it can end its turn overlapping obstructions, cover, or other characters. As its size doesn’t reflect its mass, the Squad cannot Grapple or Ram.

name: UNDERSIZE
effect: Individual soldiers can easily duck behind cover, but the sheer force of mech-scale weapons limits how effectively they can be shielded. The squad always has soft cover, even in the open, but can’t benefit from hard cover.

name: PRIMARY WEAPON
effect: This weapon can make two attacks at a time; if the Squad loses more than half its HP, it can only make one attack at a time.

name: ARMORED
effect: The Squad gains +1 Armor.

name: AMBUSHERS
effect: The Squad gains +2 Accuracy on all attacks, saves, and checks during the first round of combat.

name: DUCK AND COVER
effect: The Squad gains Resistance to the damage but becomes Immobilized until the end of their next turn.
trigger: The Squad is hit by an attack.

name: RAPID INSERTION
effect: The Squad may fly whenever it moves or Boosts.

name: DISCIPLINED
effect: Losing HP doesn’t affect the number of attacks the Squad can make each turn.

name: UNIQUE PHYSIOLOGY
effect:
If the Monstrosity has Structure (because it is an Elite or Ultra, for example), it rolls on the Monstrosity Structure Damage table when it takes structure damage.
Monstrosity Structure Damage Table
  • 5-6: Glancing Hit. The Monstrosity flinches in pain; it’s Impaired until the end of its next turn.
  • 3-4: Powerful Hit. The Monstrosity is knocked Prone by the force of the blow.
  • 2: Dismemberment. The attack blows a limb or chunk off the Monstrosity; it takes 1d6 Kinetic damage and becomes Slowed for the rest of the scene.
  • 1: Direct Hit. The result depends on the Monstrosity’s remaining Structure:
    • 3+ Structure: The Monstrosity is smacked in the head and Stunned until the end of its next turn.
    • 2 Structure: The Monstrosity must succeed on a Hull save or be destroyed.
    • 1 Structure: The Monstrosity is destroyed.
  • Multiple 1s: Fatal Hit. The Monstrosity is destroyed.

name: DEADLIEST GAME
effect: The Monstrosity has at least one optional mutation.

name: ACID SPITTLE
on_hit: Target is Shredded until the end of its next turn.

name: ADHESIVE SECRETIONS
effect: The first character damaged by the Monstrosity each turn must succeed on an Engineering save or become Slowed. This effect lasts until the target regains any HP, or for the rest of the scene.

name: BURROWER
effect: The Monstrosity burrows into the ground, as long as the surface is sufficiently malleable. While burrowed, it counts as Invisible, and can freely move through spaces occupied by characters and other obstructions; however, it can only move, Boost, or emerge into a free space (as a quick action). When the Monstrosity emerges, all characters adjacent to it must succeed on a Hull save or be knocked Prone.

name: CORROSIVE BITE
effect: A character adjacent to the Monstrosity must succeed on a Hull save or take {4/5/6} Burn. Succeed or fail, they become Shredded until they regain any HP.

name: GRASPING CLAWS
effect: The Monstrosity gains +1 Accuracy to Grapple, +1 Accuracy when attacking targets Grappled by it, and gains the ability to Boost and take reactions while grappling.

name: NATURAL CAMOUFLAGE
effect: The Monstrosity is Invisible while adjacent to any terrain or cover, and treats soft cover as hard cover.

name: RAMPAGE
effect: The Monstrosity moves spaces equal to Speed in a straight line, ignoring reactions and engagement and moving freely through spaces occupied by other characters. Characters it passes through or adjacent to must succeed on an Agility save or take {4/6/8} kinetic damage.

name: REGENERATOR
effect: At the end of its turn, the Monstrosity regains 1/4 of its total HP. It doesn’t regain any HP if it has taken Energy damage during the same round.

name: SPINED
effect: After the Monstrosity takes damage from a melee weapon, it automatically deals {1/2/3} AP kinetic damage to the attacker.

name: SWIFT
effect: Once per round, the Monstrosity can Boost during its turn as a free action.

name: TEMPERED HIDE
effect: The Monstrosity gains Resistance to any two of the following damage types: kinetic damage, Energy damage, and Explosive damage. If it is reduced to half of its total HP or less, it loses this Resistance. If it has any Structure, it regains Resistance when its HP returns to full.

name: WINGED
effect: The Monstrosity may fly whenever it moves, and doesn’t need to land at the end of movements.

name: REINFORCED
effect: The Commander gains +1 Structure and +1 Stress.

name: VOICE OF AUTHORITY
effect: The ally can reroll it.
trigger: An allied character fails an attack, check or save, and the Commander isn’t Jammed.

name: COMMANDER TRAITS
effect: The Commander chooses one option from the Commander Traits list. It doesn’t function if the Commander is Jammed.

name: BOLSTER NETWORK
effect: All allied characters within line of sight (excluding the Commander) gain +1 Accuracy on Systems saves, and tech attacks made against them receive +1 Difficulty.

name: PRESS THE ATTACK
effect: The Commander can attack the target, and deals half damage, heat or Burn if successful.
trigger: A target damages an allied character.

name: PRESS ON!
effect: The Commander clears either the Stunned condition or the Jammed condition currently affecting an allied character within line of sight.

name: QUICK MARCH
effect: One allied character within line of sight of the Commander may Boost.

name: MILITARY DISCIPLINE
effect: Allied characters adjacent to the Commander gain +1 Accuracy on all attacks, saves and checks.

name: BONUS HP
effect: The RPV gains +5 HP – it can ignore damage that would blow through the cockpit and kill a human.

name: NO PILOT
effect: The RPV has Immunity to any systems or actions that affect a pilot directly; however, it is also permanently Impaired, unable to make complex decisions or moral judgments.

name: VULNERABLE TO TECH
effect: Hostile tech actions against the RPV gain +1 Accuracy.

name: REINFORCED
effect: The Elite gains +1 Structure and +1 Stress.

name: READY AND WAITING
effect: The Elite takes two separate turns each round.

name: CAREER SOLDIER
effect: The Elite can’t take the Grunt or Ultra templates.

name: SPECIALIST KIT
effect: The Elite chooses an additional optional system from their class.

name: XENOTECH
effect: Scan doesn’t reveal any information about Exotic Systems.

name: HARDENED TARGET
effect: The Exotic gains +1 Accuracy on Systems saves, and tech attacks against them receive +1 Difficulty.

name: EXOTIC SYSTEMS
effect: The Exotic chooses up to two options from the Exotic Systems and Traits list.

name: LIVING CHASSIS
effect: This trait can only be chosen if the Exotic is a Mech. The Exotic becomes Biological.

name: BLINKSPACE CARVER
effect: The Exotic teleports when they move.

name: REALSPACE EXTRUSION
effect: This Exotic is actually an extrusion of a higher-concept entity from non-physical space, and only partially corporeal. The Exotic gains Resistance to all damage; however, they only deal half damage and other characters can freely pass through and end turns in spaces they occupy as though they aren’t there.

name: LIVING WEAPONRY
effect: The Exotic gains Immunity to Jammed. Additionally, their weapons have biotechnical and semi-organic components that spontaneously generate ammunition. When the Exotic reloads Loading weapons, they also regain 1d6 HP.

name: PARACAUSAL WEAPON
effect: Choose one of the Exotic’s weapons. Damage from that weapon can’t be reduced in any way – by Armor, Resistance, or otherwise.

name: CHRONOTORUS
effect: The Exotic causes localized distortions in the flow of time. They may either reroll 1d20 or force another character in line of sight to reroll 1d20 as a reaction. The new result must be kept.
trigger: The Exotic or another character within line of sight rolls a d20.

name: REGENERATOR
effect: At the end of the Exotic’s turn, they regain 1/4 of their total HP. They don’t regain any HP if they have taken Energy damage during the same round.

name: CHAFF
effect: The Grunt has 1 HP and can’t gain more. Unlike other characters, they never take damage when they succeed on a save – regardless of the weapon or system used – but otherwise take damage normally.

name: WEAK
effect: The Grunt can never have more than 1 Structure and 1 Stress, and they are immediately destroyed when they take heat from any source other than their own systems and weapons.

name: RANK AND FILE
effect: The Grunt can’t take the Veteran, Squad, Elite, or Ultra templates.

name: OPPORTUNIST
effect: The Mercenary gains +1 Accuracy on attacks when their target is Engaged by an allied character.

name: MERCENARY SYSTEMS AND TRAITS
effect: When choosing optional systems, the Mercenary can also choose from the Mercenary Systems and Traits list.

name: BOUNTY HUNTER
effect: Before combat begins, the GM chooses a PC: they have a bounty on their head. Any Mercenaries in the combat gain +1 Accuracy on all attacks, checks, and saves against that character – pilot and mech.

name: EFFICIENT KILLER
effect: The Mercenary gains +1 Accuracy and AP on attacks against characters with 2 Structure or less.

name: FAVORS OWED
effect: The Mercenary calls in a favor: an orbital or artillery bombardment, targeting a Blast 2 area within line of sight and range 30. Characters within the affected area must succeed on an Agility save or take {6/8/12} Explosive damage and be knocked Prone. On a success, they take half damage and aren’t knocked Prone.

name: SCOUT DRONE
effect:
Scout Drone (Size 1/2, HP 10, Evasion 10, E-Defense 10, Tags: Drone).
The Mercenary deploys the drone to a free space within Sensors. The drone creates a Burst 2 perimeter, within which characters cannot become Invisible or Hide and lose those conditions if they have them. The Mercenary also gains +1 Accuracy when attacking characters within the affected area. The drone can be deployed to a new location as a protocol.

name: LAST WORD
effect: Characters in Burst 1 must pass an Agility save or take 2 kinetic damage and become Jammed until the end of their next turn. The Mercenary then moves spaces equal to Speed in any direction. This movement ignores engagement and doesn’t provoke reactions.
trigger: The Mercenary is reduced to less than half their total HP.

name: DEADLY
effect: The Pirate deals +1d6 bonus damage on critical hits.

name: PIRATE SYSTEMS AND TRAITS
effect: When choosing optional systems, the Pirate can also choose from the Pirate Systems and Traits list.

name: BOARDING LEASH
on_hit: Target must pass a Hull save or be pulled directly to the Pirate and automatically Grappled.

name: SPLINTER ROUNDS
effect: The Pirate deals +3 bonus damage on critical hits.

name: COREWORM ROCKETS
effect:
1d3 miniature drones attach themselves to a character within line of sight and Range 10 and begin drilling into their target’s cockpit. In 1d3+2 rounds, if any coreworms are still attached, they reach the cockpit and savage the pilot, reducing them to 0 HP. The target knows how many rounds it will take for the drones to bore though, and how many are attached.
The target and allied characters adjacent to them can remove one drone at a time with a successful Systems or Engineering check as a quick action. Additionally, if the target is Shut Down, the coreworms are confused and their timer pauses.

name: PRYING CLAWS
effect: The Pirate attempts to pry open the cockpit of a character adjacent to them. The target must succeed on a Hull save or the pilot is forced to immediately exit their mech as though Dismounting.

name: SLAVER SIGNAL
effect: A piloted mech or vehicle within Range 10 must make a Systems save. On a failure, all pilots and other Biological characters inside the target are overcome by the signal, becoming Stunned. Unless their mech or vehicle has an AI, it also becomes Stunned. If any affected characters (or their mech or vehicle) take damage, they are jolted awake – ending the effect. Characters adjacent to the target can also end the effect by blotting out the signal with a successful Systems check as a full action. Otherwise, the effect lasts until the Pirate is destroyed.

name: FLIER
effect: The Ship moves normally in zero-g environments. In-atmosphere, it hovers. It gains Immunity to Immobilized, Stunned and Prone.

name: MASSIVE SIZE
effect: The Ship is Size 4. Though it is larger than most mechs, it is small by ship standards; larger ships are too heavily armored to be damaged by mech-scale weapons.

name: CREW
effect: The Ship has at least two crewmembers.

name: ARMORED HULL
effect: The Ship gains +5 HP.

name: NO MANIPULATORS
effect: The Ship can’t pick up objects, manipulate objects or the environment, or Grapple.

name: LIMITED MELEE ATTACKS
effect: The Ship can’t make melee attacks other than Ram.

name: TRANSPORT
effect: The Ship can transport one Squad or characters whose combined Size is less than its own Size.

name: MANEUVERABLE
effect: The Spacer moves normally in zero-g environments.

name: SPACER SYSTEMS
effect: When choosing optional systems, the Spacer can also choose from the Spacer Systems list.

name: GRAVITY RIFLE
on_hit: Targets must pass a Hull save or be pulled in a straight line towards the Spacer, up to 10 spaces or until they hit an obstruction. If they collide with an obstruction, they are additionally knocked Prone.

name: SEALANT TRAP
effect: When a hostile character moves adjacent to the mine, characters within a Burst 1 area are covered with a spray of thick, fast-drying sealant and become Immobilized. They remain stuck until the sealant takes sufficient damage to break; it counts as having {5/10/15} HP and Evasion 5.

name: THUMPER GRENADES
effect:
The Spacer expends a charge for the following effect:
Thumper grenade (Grenade, range 5, Blast 1): Characters in the affected area must pass an Agility check or be knocked 3 spaces back, directly away from the center of the explosion. If this causes them to collide with an obstruction, they are also knocked Prone.

name: BEST OF THE BEST
effect: The Ultra can’t take the Elite or Grunt templates.

name: SHOCK AND AWE
effect:
The Ultra takes two separate turns each round. They regain spent reactions each time they take a turn.
If the Ultra is facing five or more hostile characters when combat begins, the Ultra takes a third turn each round.

name: DEADLY
effect: The Ultra deals +1d6 damage on critical hits.

name: JUGGERNAUT
effect: At the start of the Ultra’s turn, they clear one condition. At the end of their turn, they repair one destroyed weapon or system.

name: REINFORCED
effect: The Ultra gains +3 Structure and +3 Stress.

name: LEGENDARY
effect: The Ultra rolls all structure damage and overheating checks twice and chooses either result.

name: ADVANCED KIT
effect: The Ultra chooses 1–2 additional optional systems from their class.

name: RESILIENT
effect: The Ultra gains +5 HP.

name: REFLEX
effect: The Ultra can Overwatch unlimited times per round.

name: ULTRA SYSTEMS AND TRAITS
effect: The Ultra chooses 1–3 options from the Ultra Systems and Traits list.

name: HOVER PROPULSION
effect: The Ultra can hover when they move or Boost.

name: REPULSION FIELD
effect: When hostile characters start their turn adjacent to the Ultra or become adjacent to the Ultra for the first time on their turn, they take {2/4/6} Energy damage + 2 heat and must succeed on a Systems save or become Impaired until the end of their next turn.

name: SIEGE SHIELD
effect: The Ultra gains Resistance to all damage from attacks that originate beyond range 3.

name: SLIVERSHIELDING
effect: This system replaces Resilient. The Ultra becomes permanently Invisible.

name: SHORT-CYCLE LANCE
effect: Draw a line 30 path: characters within the affected area must succeed on an Agility save or take 1 structure damage. On a success, they are reduced to 1 HP. Objects smaller than Size 5 are completely annihilated.

name: VOLLEY MODULE
effect:
The Ultra adopts a stable stance and prepares one of their weapons. On their next turn, as a protocol, the Ultra uses the prepared weapon to attack any number of characters, as long as they are within Range, and aren’t in cover or Prone. All characters are aware of this attack and can choose to drop Prone as a free action on their turn to avoid being targeted.
The Ultra can attack unlimited times with the prepared weapon as part of this effect, even if it’s Loading.

name: WOLFHOUND MISSILE
effect:
Wolfhound Missile (Size 1, HP {10/15/20}, Evasion 10, E-Defense 10, Tags: Drone)
The Ultra chooses a character within line of sight and range 30, then deploys the wolfhound missile to an adjacent space. At the start of each of the Ultra’s subsequent turns, the missile flies 3 spaces towards the target, or 6 spaces if the target has Lock On. The missile moves as directly as possible, but maneuvers around cover and obstructions as long as there is space to do so. When the missile collides with a character or reaches the target, it detonates with a Blast 1 explosion. Characters within the affected area must make an Agility save. On fail, they take {14/20/28} Energy damage; on a success, they take half damage.
The Ultra can only deploy one wolfhound missile at a time, and this system can only recharge once the missile has detonated.

name: ARGUS ARMOR
effect: The Ultra has 6 Armor. Each time they roll a structure damage or overheating check, they lose 2 Armor, to a minimum of 0.

name: DEVASTATOR
effect: 1/round, when the Ultra makes a successful attack, all characters within line of sight take {2/4/6} kinetic, Explosive, or Energy damage.

name: EVASIVE
effect: The Ultra gains +4 Evasion (to a maximum of 20) and –1 Structure.

name: EXTRA DEADLY
effect: The first critical hit the Ultra performs each turn deals +2d6 damage at Tier 2 or +3d6 damage at Tier 3.

name: FORTRESS
effect: The Ultra gains +3 Accuracy on Systems saves, and tech attacks against them receive +3 difficulty.

name: LEAD THE CHARGE
effect: The Ultra can Boost. This reaction can be used any number of times a round.
trigger: A hostile character in line of sight moves.

name: LEGION
effect: The Ultra gains +4 E-Defense (to a maximum of 20) and +1 Accuracy on all tech attacks.

name: LIMITLESS
effect: The Ultra can Overcharge. Instead of the standard cost, they always gain 1d6 heat.

name: SIGHT
effect: The Ultra ignores Invisible, and hostile characters within Sensors can’t Hide.

name: SUPERIOR CONSTRUCTION
effect: This trait replaces Resilient. The Ultra gains Resistance to one damage type – kinetic damage, Energy damage, or Explosive damage. They can’t gain permanent Resistance to more than two damage types, whether from this or any other system.

name: SUPERIOR FRAME
effect: The Ultra gains Immunity to Slowed, Shredded, and Immobilized.

name: SUPERIOR REACTOR
effect: The Ultra gains Immunity to Stunned and Exposed.

name: SUPERIOR TARGETING
effect: The Ultra ignores cover when making ranged attacks.

name: SUPREME MAINTENANCE
effect: The Ultra gains Immunity to Jammed; additionally, the Ultra can reload one Loading weapon as a free action on their turn and can repair a destroyed weapon or system as a quick action.

name: SUPREME MELEE
effect: The Ultra gains +1 Accuracy on all melee attacks; additionally, once on their turn, the Ultra can Grapple, Ram, or make a melee attack as a free action.

name: UNSTOPPABLE
effect: The Ultra gains Immunity to all involuntary movement, including Knockback and Prone.

name: HELLFIRE PROJECTOR
effect: This weapon can make two attacks at a time, but the area of the two attacks can’t overlap.

name: RAVAGER TURRET
effect: This weapon simultaneously attacks every hostile character within line of sight and Range.

name: REINFORCED
effect: The Veteran gains +1 Structure and +1 Stress.

name: VETERANCY
effect: The Veteran gains +1 Accuracy on all checks and saves for one mech skill (chosen at creation): Hull, Agility, Systems, or Engineering.

name: VETERAN TRAITS
effect: The Veteran gains one Veteran Trait per tier.

name: ACROBAT
effect: After the Veteran move or Boosts, they can fly 3 spaces. This flight ignores engagement and doesn’t provoke reactions.

name: DEADLY
effect: The Veteran deals +1d6 damage on critical hits.

name: FEIGN DEATH
effect: The first time that the Veteran is destroyed each combat, they are actually feigning death – they appear to be destroyed, but have 1 HP. Characters adjacent to the Veteran can reveal this with a successful Systems check or pilot skill check; otherwise, the Veteran remains unnoticed until they move or take an action.

name: HACKER
effect: The Veteran deals +2 heat on successful tech attacks.

name: HARDENED TARGET
effect: The Veteran gains +1 Accuracy on Systems saves, and tech attacks against them receive +1 Difficulty.

name: HEADSHOT
effect: 1/round, on a critical hit, the Veteran’s target must pass a Hull save or only be able to draw line of sight to adjacent spaces until the end of their next turn.

name: INSULATED
effect: The Veteran gains Immunity to Burn.

name: LEGENDARY
effect: The Veteran rolls all structure damage and overheating checks twice and chooses either result.

name: LESSER SIGHT
effect: The Veteran ignores Invisible for characters within range 3, and hostile characters in range 3 can’t Hide successfully (though they remain Hidden if they were already).

name: LIGHTNING REFLEXES
effect: Whenever the Veteran is attacked using any Heavy or Superheavy weapon, first roll 1d6. On 5+, the attack automatically misses.

name: LIMITLESS
effect: The Veteran can Overcharge. Instead of the standard cost, they always gain 1d6 heat.

name: NHP CO-PILOT
effect: The Veteran gains the AI tag. Their mech or vehicle is autonomous and can even function without a pilot. The NHP can enter cascade, using the same rules as PC AIs.

name: PARTING GIFT
effect: The Veteran can Self-Destruct (see p. 72).

name: RODEO MASTER
effect: The Veteran can Dismount. While on foot, the Veteran uses the Human class and can take all actions available to PC pilots, including Jockey.

name: SELF REPAIR
effect: 1/scene, as a Full Action, the Veteran regains all HP and clears all conditions.

name: SHOCK ARMOR
effect: The Veteran gains Resistance to damage from Main weapons.

name: SLIPPERY
effect: The Veteran’s standard moves ignore engagement and don’t provoke reactions.

name: STEEL JAW
effect: Auxiliary weapons can’t do more than 1 damage to the Veteran.

name: VIPER’S SPEED
effect: The Veteran always takes the first turn, even acting before PCs. Whenever there is a question about who acts first – in both narrative play and mech combat – it is always the Veteran. If multiple characters have this trait, only one gets to use it each time.

name: LIMITED HANDLING
effect: The Vehicle must always move in a straight line, although it can move and Boost in separate directions. Additionally, the Vehicle can’t climb or swim, and can only clear Prone when adjacent to an allied character.

name: CREW
effect: If the Vehicle is larger than Size 1/2, it may have a crew; if so, it has at least as many crew members as half its Size.

name: NO MANIPULATORS
effect: The Vehicle can’t pick up objects, manipulate objects or the environment, or Grapple.

name: LIMITED MELEE
effect: The Vehicle can’t make melee attacks other than Ram.

name: TYPE
effect: The Vehicle can choose one or more options from the Vehicle Traits list.

name: FLIER
effect: The Vehicle can fly when it moves or Boosts.

name: TRANSPORT
effect: The Vehicle can transport one Squad or characters whose combined Size is less than its own Size.

name: TREADS OR HOVER
effect: The Vehicle ignores difficult terrain.
